decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures into the graveyard, then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces and control the opponent's game plan. The creatures in the deck are high-impact threats that can quickly close out the game once they hit the battlefield. The lands are optimized for consistency and include powerful utility lands like Wasteland and Undercity Sewers.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. By using efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect your game plan, while also disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize, this deck aims to quickly close out games by reanimating high-impact creatures such as Archon of Cruelty or Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes some versatile threats like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to apply pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's board while applying pressure with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will, while also utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Murktide Regent to deal with threats. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and can generate value in longer games. The deck aims to maintain a tempo advantage by bouncing threats with Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back to the battlefield for a low cost with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with these reanimated threats, such as Brazen Borrower, Murktide Regent, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also disrupting their strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The mana base is designed to support this strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands for consistency and flexibility.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifacts, particularly powerful ones like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Bauble, to generate fast and aggressive plays. Emry, Lurker of the Loch serves as a key piece in recurring these artifacts from the graveyard, while cards like Thought Monitor and Pinnacle Emissary provide additional value. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Metallic Rebuke and Force of Will to protect its game plan. Urza's Saga and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain are included to provide additional artifact synergy and win conditions.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on disrupting opponents with cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Ensnaring Bridge while using aggressive creatures like Magus of the Moon and Broadside Bombardiers to quickly close out the game. The deck also utilizes Karn, the Great Creator to search for artifacts like The One Ring and Sundering Eruption to further control the game state. With a strong mana base provided by City of Traitors, Ancient Tomb, and Urza's Saga, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its disruptive elements and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces by tutoring and ramping with cards like Green Sun's Zenith, Chord of Calling, and Noble Hierarch. The key strategy revolves around using Nadu, Winged Wisdom's ability to draw cards by targeting Nomads en-Kor, allowing for card advantage and setting up the win condition with cards like Craterhoof Behemoth and Springheart Nantuko. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Endurance to control the game and protect the combo. The mana base is built to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistency in executing the combo.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to generate infinite mana with Nomads en-Kor and Delighted Halfling, allowing you to cast your entire deck with Nadu, Winged Wisdom and win the game. This combo relies on protecting your pieces with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, while also utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to tutor for key creatures. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Endurance to disrupt your opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to lock down the opponent using artifacts, primarily by preventing them from activating key abilities and disrupting their mana base. This is achieved through cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Pithing Needle. The deck also aims to generate significant mana advantage through cards like Candelabra of Tawnos and Grim Monolith, allowing the player to cast powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Emrakul. By establishing control early on and assembling a powerful board state, this deck aims to dominate the late game and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and It That Heralds the End, and use cards like Kozilek's Command and Glaring Fleshraker to control the game. With a combination of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, the deck can quickly deploy its threats and outpace the opponent.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void to control the game. With mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to deploy threats quickly and efficiently. The mana base includes lands like Ancient Tomb and Eye of Ugin to help cast the high-cost Eldrazi creatures. Overall, the deck's strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, using cards like Faithless Looting and Entomb. By utilizing reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead, the deck aims to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield at a low cost. Additionally, using cards like Thoughtseize and Unmask, the deck can disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own combo plays. This deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures early in the game and close out matches swiftly.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back onto the battlefield using spells like Entomb and Reanimate. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also having disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game. The deck also includes cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent for flexibility and additional threats. The land base is optimized for mana fixing and disruption with Wasteland and utility lands like Undercity Sewers.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a low cost. This strategy relies on utilizing combo pieces like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Reanimate while also incorporating disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. By efficiently reanimating creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and secure the win.
